intro: Deyeuxia conferta var. guoxuniana, commonly known as the Guoxun sedge, is a perennial grass species native to China. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae and is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or marshy areas. It produces small, clustered inflorescences with tiny, three-lobed flowers. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and ecological importance in stabilizing wetland environments.
